title: Order and Customer summary broken when Invoices are off

labels.name: Order
labels.description: Component: Which BO section is concerned

labels.name: Customer

body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

Hi, I noticed a problem on Presta version 1.7.8.8. 

When you turn off invoices - stats for orders and customers are showing "0" per each order
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26142543/216174094-8bb4578d-a4a0-43ea-b588-a8326aab917d.png)


### Expected behavior

When you turn Invoices back on - it works fine
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26142543/216173883-3e2e5d33-e72c-42d0-8945-20b1d7973cf3.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26142543/216173964-895f721b-ed59-4c82-8ff8-6b119ea5380f.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. In the Orders/Invoices menu, turn off invoices
2. Make an order, pay with whatever method you want (I tested custom modules: P24, BlueMedia, PayOnDelivery made by Presta and built-in bankwire module)
3. Make sure the order has proper status (paid, marked as finished, etc)
4. Go to order details, basket summary shows 0 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26142543/216174478-a0a03f84-906d-4151-9001-264126870287.png)
5. Go to customer list/summary, shows 0
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26142543/216174543-6cd23f1f-53f8-4f99-906f-03b091b982d3.png)



### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

1.7.8.X

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

7.3

### If your bug is related to a module, specify its name and its version

_No response_

title: Product url is added to browser's history on add to cart

labels.name: Duplicate
labels.description: Resolution: issue closed because already reported

body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [x] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add screenshots

When in product's page and adding product to a cart, each time Prestashop is adding product's url to the browser's history, so, let's say if I add a product to a cart on a same product's page, I would have to press Back button twice in a browser in order to go back to a previous page, thrice, if I would add same product 2 times and so on...

The issue is present on a clean Prestashop installation without any modifications. Is this behavior intended? Older versions of PS (1.6x) did not had this issue. 

Here's what I mean:

![Peek 2022-01-31 13-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98745844/151790088-d3fb513b-fbac-49b1-bd31-7fbe8854642a.gif)


### Expected behavior

Prestashop shouldn't add new history record to browser when adding product to a cart.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to Product page
2. Add product to a cart
3. Try to go back with browser's back button to a previous page

### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

1.7.8.2, 1.7.8.3

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

7.4.27

### If your bug is related to a module, specify its name and its version

_No response_

title: BO - The bulk action shouldn't be displayed on the shopping carts page when there is no shopping carts with No ordered status

labels.name: Shopping carts
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

labels.name: Ready
labels.description: Status: Issue is ready to be worked on

body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

The bulk action shouldn't be displayed on the shopping carts page when there is no shopping carts with No ordered status

**PS 8.1.0_beta : NOK** :x: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92912932/219415286-c0408777-211c-444f-b992-2758176ac87a.png)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92912932/219415562-a4597e6f-5dae-49d7-b4db-c405c8705d11.mp4

**PS 8.0.1 : OK** :heavy_check_mark: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92912932/219415311-e0367f1d-6e7d-425c-b5d5-1e677bef8a60.png)

[Untitled_ Feb 16, 2023 4_20 PM (1).webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92912932/219415953-cde94d58-506f-4b3a-b9b4-2a5662670a11.webm)

So, it's a regression on 8.1.0_beta !

### Expected behavior

The bulk action should not be displayed!

### Steps to reproduce

1. Use 8.1.0_beta

title: Fix: Address Fields Disappear After Changing Country on Checkout Page
body:

body:
| Questions         | Answers
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------------------
| Branch?           | 8.0.x
| Description?      | In "update notifications" view, action buttons don't update properly after some actions. As discussed in #28612, I removed button menu for update action under update menu. 
| Type?             | bug fix
| Category?         | BO
| BC breaks?        | no
| Deprecations?     | no
| Fixed ticket?     | Fixes #28433.
| Related PRs       | #28612
| How to test?      | Cf. #28433. :point_up: Please notice that to reproduce / test the bug you need to have modules that require to be updated so you may have to downgrade manually a module (in module folder and in db).  
| Possible impacts? | All actions menu in module manager and any code that depends on `ModuleRepository::getModule(...)`

As mentioned in #28433 , after upgrading or uninstalling a module, the module is not removed from update list without a page refresh (F5). I fixed this problem with some js refactoring (`refreshNeeded` part)

Then the main problem was linked to [ModuleController](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/ed982dc0966bd5e9c1e902685bef075191b14c9e/src/PrestaShopBundle/Controller/Admin/Improve/ModuleController.php#L251) that recreate action menu dynamically. But it uses directly ``ModuleRepository::getModule()`` method that does not apply 'actionListModules' hook for Module description (I suspect it is linked to autoupgrade module).

body:
| Questions         | Answers
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------------------
| Branch?           | 8.0.x
| Description?      | In "update notifications" view, action buttons don't update properly after some actions. 
| Type?             | bug fix
| Category?         | BO
| BC breaks?        | no
| Deprecations?     | no
| Fixed ticket?     | Fixes #28433.
| Related PRs       |
| How to test?      | Cf. #28433. :point_up: Please notice that to reproduce / test the bug you need to have modules that require to be updated so you may have to downgrade manually a module (in module folder and in db).  
| Possible impacts? | All actions menu in module manager and any code that depends on `ModuleRepository::getModule(...)`


As mentioned in #28433 , after upgrading or uninstalling a module, the module is not removed from update list without a page refresh (F5). I fixed this problem with some js refactoring (`refreshNeeded` part)

Then the main problem was linked to [ModuleController](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/ed982dc0966bd5e9c1e902685bef075191b14c9e/src/PrestaShopBundle/Controller/Admin/Improve/ModuleController.php#L251) that recreate action menu dynamically. But it uses directly ``ModuleRepository::getModule()`` method that does not apply 'actionListModules' hook for Module description (I suspect it is linked to autoupgrade module).

title: Cart rules & Multistore - Restriction on Store selection is still displayed after I disable multistore option

labels.name: Multistore
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

labels.name: Cart rules
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [x] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

When I disable Multistore option from my Shop Parameters, I should not see anything related to Multistore in my Cart rules.

PS 8.2.0:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eb6a6ed7-3709-495a-9bfb-95856dc6b7ff)

PS 9.0.0:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e12f99a6-aa31-44b6-8ee2-dc9913f0f555)

### Expected behavior

When I disable Multistore option from my Shop Parameters, I should not see anything related to Multistore in my Cart rules.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to BO > Shop Parameters > General > Enable multistore
2. Go to > Advanced parameters > Multistore 
3. Add a new store > Set a URL for the store
4. Go to Catalog > Discounts > Add new cart rule
5. Go to Tab Conditions > See Store selection in Restriction
6. Add any Action > Save
7. Go to Shop Parameters > General > Disable multistore
8. Go to Catalog > Discounts > Edit your cart rule > Go to Conditions tab
9. See. Store selection is still displayed in Restriction options :x:


### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

8.2.x, 9.0.x

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

8.1

_No response_

title: fix: remove backslashes for checkout step identifier
body:

title: Fix duplicate / wrongly pluralized error message on field length in BO
body:
<!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thank you for contributing to the PrestaShop project! 

Please take the time to edit the "Answers" rows below with the necessary information.

Check out our contribution guidelines to find out how to complete it:
https://devdocs.prestashop.com/8/contribute/contribution-guidelines/#pull-requests
------------------------------------------------------------------------------>

| Questions         | Answers
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------------------
| Branch?           |  8.0.x 
| Description?           |  An issue was reported about an error message being duplicated. After investigation, it turned out that the message was wrongly pluralized, displaying both singular and plural versions of an error message. Symfony 4.4 is supposed to handle those messages. The problem that was found was that the PrestashopTranslatorTrait ( which is a custom Prestashop layer on top of Symfony's translation system) had some issues, mainly the fact that it would not pass the `$parameters`parameter to the parent function trans(), preventing it to get the `%count%` index in the array parameters, preventing symfony from choosing between singular and plural versions.
| Type?             | bug fix
| Category?         | BO
| BC breaks?        | no
| Deprecations?     | no
| Fixed ticket?     | Fixes https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues/28877
| Related PRs       | (https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/pull/29040 https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/pull/29396).
| How to test?      | Go to BO > Catalog > Products V1 > Add Product > Fill the "Name" field with less than 3 or more than 128 characters > Click Save button > See error : 'This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.' OR 'This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less.' with good pluralization according to context.
| Possible impacts? | All form fields with a length constraint.


<!-- Click the form's "Preview" button to make sure the table is functional in GitHub. Thank you! -->
Note : I've had to make another PR cause i made a mess when rebasing the previous one and it was quicker than trying to go up the gitflow tree but there was interesting discussions please check https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/pull/29040 AND https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/pull/29396

### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add screenshots

If module has few different languages translated it will auto-fill missing fields with default language.
For example if default BO lang is set to NL and we try to translate the LT one, the missing LT fields will be filled with the filled NL fields. As I understand it should stay empty, because its hard to find missing fields for LT lang if the missing ones are filled with other lang.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51944825/197165969-c22f41fd-ce88-449d-b8f8-29165ff634c8.png)


### Expected behavior

If the translations are missing for the selected lang it should stay missing and not filled with default BO lang translations

### Steps to reproduce

1. Select any module that you want to test
2. Translated selected language, for example Netherlands.
3. Change BO language to Netherlands (profile->language)
4. Try to translate same module in Lithuanian language (can use any other language)
5. If the translation doesn't exist in Lithuanian but exists in Netherlands it will be filled with Netherlands translations

### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

1.7+

_No response_

title: Translation fixes
body:
| Questions | Answers | ----------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | Branch? | 9.0.x | Description? | Improve translator catalog updates during the processes that update the XLF catalog themselves, this improves (among other things):
- installation with multiple languages (the menu was not correctly translated in all languages in the Tab DB)
- importing a new localization pack, the Tab element that use a module wording were not correctly updated | Type? | bug fix | Category? | CO | BC breaks? | no | Deprecations? | no | How to test? | | UI Tests | https://github.com/jolelievre/ga.tests.ui.pr/actions/runs/14066048488 | Fixed issue or discussion? | ~ | Related PRs | ~ | Sponsor company | ~ ### How to test 1. Install the shop with CLI command to force a language different from the country selected, this forces the installation of two different languages during the install process (I'm not sure if it's doable with the web interface), you must make sure that your cache folder is empty and that you have no zip and no folders for any languages in the `translations` folder 2. CLI command `php install-dev/index_cli.php --language=en --country=fr --db_create=1` (you may need additional parameters for the DB settings, the domain, the email and stuff but that's related to your environment and how you're used to test) 3. Log in the BO you should be in English by default, go to your profile and change the language of your employee to French 4. The menu is translated because during the install process the catalogues were not available therefore the DB is filled with english values 5. The form itself is not translated, because the catalogue was not available when the translator created its cache and now it's empty for french until cache is cleared 6. Clear the cache (by removing the `var/cache/*` folders for example), refresh the page now at least the form labels are translated, but the menu content from DB is still not translated Perform this same steps with the PR now (make sure to remove the cache and downloaded cataloged in translation folder both the zip and the language folder) Retry the full install both problems should be fixed: - the menu is correctly translated in all languages - when you switch your language the whole BO is correctly translated without cleaning the cache

title: Do not attempt to rebuild modules list if missing data
body:
<!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thank you for contributing to the PrestaShop project!

Please take the time to edit the "Answers" rows below with the necessary information.

Check out our contribution guidelines to find out how to complete it:
https://devdocs.prestashop-project.org/8/contribute/contribution-guidelines/#pull-requests

For type and category see:
https://devdocs.prestashop-project.org/8/contribute/contribution-guidelines/pull-requests/#type--category
------------------------------------------------------------------------------>

| Questions         | Answers
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------------------
| Branch?           | 8.1.x
| Description?      | See below
| Type?             | bug fix
| Category?         | BO
| BC breaks?        | no
| Deprecations?     | no
| How to test?      | See issue https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues/33629
| Fixed ticket?     | Fixes #33629
| Related PRs       | 
| Sponsor company   | 

# Explanation of the problem behind #33629

In PR https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/pull/31285 the following code [has been added](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/pages/module/controller.js#L748):
```
this.eventEmitter.emit((responseObject.upgraded ? 'Module Upgraded' : 'Module Installed'), elem);
```
The event is then catched in [line 229](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/pages/module/controller.js#L229) which calls `installHandler(event)` which calls `updateModuleStatus(event)`

[Function `updateModuleStatus()`](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/pages/module/controller.js#L237) is supposed to update the object modulesList which model the modules listing in the BO page. As you can see on lines 245, 246... it attempts to extract many data properties from this `event` input:
```
  updateModuleStatus(event) {
    this.modulesList = this.modulesList.map((module) => {
      const moduleElement = $(event);

      if (moduleElement.data('tech-name') === module.techName) {
        const newModule = {
          domObject: moduleElement,
          id: moduleElement.data('id'),
          name: moduleElement.data('name').toLowerCase(),
          scoring: parseFloat(moduleElement.data('scoring')) ...
```
The problem is that the input does not contain these data properties. It only contains one: `tech-name`. No `id`, `name`, `version`...

So we have a JavaScript error `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'toLowerCase')` and the page JS crashes. The page remains stuck, no JS action works anymore and the user cannot close the modal window.

# Explanation of the fix

In my PR I simply modify function `updateModuleStatus()` and, before the moduleList is being updated, I verify the expected data is provided. I added a check `(moduleElement.data('version') !== undefined)` which will be triggered in the usecase above. If `event` only contains `tech-name` and no `id`, `name`, `version`... it will not enter the loop.

This is a quick fix that absolutely does not solve the root problem.

# Why I did not fix the root problem

At first I thought the root problem was that `event` was not correct. It should contain `id`, `name`, `version`... and I thought the right fix was to provide these informations in line [748](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/pages/module/controller.js#L748).

However then I had a look at the other places in the code where the event (or another that triggers `updateModuleStatus()`) is being thrown. You can see them [here](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/components/module-card.ts#L443) or [here](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/8.1.x/admin-dev/themes/new-theme/js/components/module-card.ts#L463).

Did you notice? When `Module installed` event is thrown, the code passes the jQuery element `jqElementObj.closest(".${alteredSelector}");`. This element contains `id`, `name`, `version` as `data` attribute. This is the data I need for my usecase. But where does it come from? When was provided this `data`?

This `data` was actually provided from the start, when the page was loaded first. It was there since the beginning. It was not provided by an ajax call. Looking more precisely, I realized that this back-office page does NOT handle the usecase "if I add a module, the module list gets populated".

Modules that are already present on the disk already belong to this list so their `data` attribute is populated.  They do not get "added" to the list. The problem is when BO user uses the dropzone to add a new module. It is not added to the list (and consequently it does not have the `data` I need). Right: today, as a back-office user, if you use the dropzone to add a new module to the list, the interface tells you "youhou! install was successfull!" you close the modal window and... the list has not changed. You need to refresh the page to see your new module appear.

As of today, the modules listing on the back-office page is not capable of adding new items. You can modify items, you can delete some... but it does not support adding new items. You need to refresh the web page to see your new module appear in the list, when the list is rebuild from scratch. So the `data` is never added if you upload a new module. So I will never be able to grab my `data` and send them to `updateModuleStatus()` : it's not even here from the start!

And this is the real problem. The behavior of this modules listing on this back-office page, the behavior of this `modulesList` object is missing one usecase: how to handle "adding a module via the dropzone". It was simply not implemented :grin: the code was never written. And that is why I don't have the `data` I need for the function

When someone does a PR to correctly handle the "adding a module via the dropzone" usecase, he will properly fetch the new module data, populate the modulesList and the DOM. That will probably solve the issue naturally.

This PR is a simple workaround to avoid blocking the modal window. It will allow users to use the back-office page but the underlying problem remains: "adding a module via the dropzone" on this back-office page is not handled properly. The modules listing is not updated, the user needs to refresh the page. When this usecase is solved, the issue #33629 will be really solved.

title: Unable to add a first address with error "Invalid postcode" in some circumstances

labels.name: Multistore
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

labels.name: Countries
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

As a customer, I'm unable to create my first address with a country that has not the 'NNNNN' zip code format.
![Immagine 2023-01-20 115746](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7520695/213679356-6c368d48-b47a-4077-a00e-f31ac4f68664.png)

This bug happens in this circumstances
- Multishop installation
- Main shop has default country `France`, second shop has default country `Switzerland`
- `France` is not associated to second shop, `Switzerland` is not associated to main shop


### Expected behavior

It should be possible to add an address with any country in the drop down list.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a clean installation of Prestashop using https://gist.github.com/lmeyer1/c40a19d880758bee11a1e8a2c5e819c3
2. Log into BO, `All shops` context
3. Go to `International - Locations - Countries`, enable `France`. Make sure `France` and `Switzerland` are both enabled.
4. Click on `France`. In shop associations, uncheck `Shop A`
5. Click on `Switzerland`. In shop associations, uncheck `Prestashop default`
6. Go to `International - Localization`
7. Change to `Prestashop default` context. Set `France` as *Default country*.
8. Change to `Shop A` context. Set `Switzerland` as *Default country*.
9. As a customer open Shop A.
10. Create a new account
11. In `Your Account` click on `Add first Address`
12. Enter an *Address*, enter a *Zip code* with four numbers (as Swiss zip codes are), enter a *City* and select `Switzerland` as *Country*.
13. Click save and learn that in Switzerland post codes with 4 numbers are invalid: it says `Invalid postcode - should look like "NNNNN"`

### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

8.0.0, not able to reproduce on 1.7.8.7

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

8.4

### If your bug is related to a module, specify its name and its version

_No response_

| Description?      | The query in getAttributeParams() currently fetches al.name, which contains attribute private names. Since this is publicly visible to the user in the URL, we should fetch the public_name instead. This can be considered a bug since private fields are not expected to be made visible publicly.

title: Error: 'No Carriers Available' Message When Deleting Address with Products in Cart

labels.name: Waiting for PM
labels.description: Status: action required, waiting for product feedback

labels.name: Needs Specs
labels.description: Status: issue needs to be specified

labels.name: Addresses
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

labels.name: Carriers
labels.description: Label: Which BO under menu is concerned

labels.name: Shopping carts FO
labels.description: All the issues related to the Front Office Shopping Cart

body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I understand and accept the project's [code of conduct](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/blob/develop/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have already [searched in existing issues](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3ABug) and found no previous report of this bug.

### Describe the bug and add attachments

When a user begins the checkout process, selects a delivery address, but does not complete the payment process, and later, an administrator deletes the address that the customer previously selected from the back office, an issue arises. If the customer returns to complete their checkout and adds a new address, they encounter the error message "Unfortunately, there are no carriers available for your delivery address." This error occurs even when the new address should have carriers available.

Address deleted from the backoffice:
![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/f69b198a-4835-4996-8814-a133017fa130)
Error message in the checkout process
![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/08007a58-f3a1-486e-8331-82ae706e2a98)


### Expected behavior

When a user adds a new address during the checkout process, the system should accurately display the carriers available for that address, ensuring that the customer can proceed with their purchase smoothly.

### Steps to reproduce

Begin the checkout process as a customer.

Select or create a delivery address during the checkout but do not complete the entire process (i.e., do not make the payment).

![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/6029d10e-698c-4377-9f23-3399e3ee0382)

As an administrator, access the back office.

Locate and delete the customer's previously selected address from the back office.

![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/abcc89c5-948d-4937-90c0-b71d18f2067f)

The customer returns to complete their checkout process.

During this return visit, the customer creates a new or the same delivery address and selects it for the order.

![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/1c4f2684-07ec-4113-9da7-fddcdae5e15b)

Observe the issue: The system indicates that no carriers are available for the newly selected delivery address, even though carriers should be available for it.

![image](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/assets/40273288/97774f2d-e92a-409a-b42e-952fe59c667f)


### PrestaShop version(s) where the bug happened

1.7.8.10

### PHP version(s) where the bug happened

7.4.0

### If your bug is related to a module, specify its name and its version

_No response_

### Your company or customer's name goes here (if applicable).

_No response_
